item.title: Django under massive loads
item.description:
Description

The Python web framework Django can handle extremely high levels of traffic… with appropriate design and support. We’ll go over techniques to keep your Django site from being crushed under high load.
Topics include:
  • Schema/model design
  • Caching
  • Efficient view function design
  • Caching
  • Template design for high performance
  • Caching
  • Database tuning and sharding
  • Caching

We’ll also discuss caching.
item.dc:creator: Christophe Pettus

item.title: PostgreSQL when it is not your job
item.description:
Description

In this DevOps world, Django programmers are increasingly being asked to manage the database as well. In 45 brisk minutes, we will talk about (nearly) everything you need to know to bring up, tune, and keep a PostgreSQL database health. We'll go over installation, basic tuning, backups, disaster recovery, and helpful tools and techniques.
item.dc:creator: Christophe Pettus

item.title: Really, Really Fast Django
item.description:
Description

Django can handle extremely high levels of traffic… with appropriate design and support. We’ll go over techniques to keep your Django site from being crushed under high load.

Topics include:

  • Schema/model design
  • Caching
  • Efficient view function design
  • Caching
  • Template design for high performance
  • Caching
  • Database tuning and sharding
  • Caching

We’ll also discuss caching.
item.dc:creator: Christophe Pettus

item.title: DjangoCon EU 2013: Christophe Pettus - Advanced PostgreSQL in Django
item.description:
Description

Videos from DjangoCon Europe 2013 are kindly provided by Heroku, a cloud application platform -- a new way of building and deploying web apps: http://heroku.com/
item.dc:creator: Christophe Pettus

item.title: Django and PostgreSQL: An Even-Closer Union
item.description:
Description

DjangoCon US 2016 - Django and PostgreSQL: An Even-Closer Union by Christophe Pettus

Django 1.8 and 1.9 include many very cool PostgreSQL-related features. Let's show them off!
item.dc:creator: Christophe Pettus

item.title: Django 1.8/1.9 and PostgreSQL: An Ever-Closer Union
item.description:
Description

Speaker: Christophe Pettus

Django 1.8/1.9 adds a whole bunch of cool new features that are specifically designed for PostgreSQL. We'll take a quick tour through them, and show when and how you can use them in real-world applications. We'll also talk about how to get the best performance out of PostgreSQL when using the Django ORM.

Slides can be found at: https://speakerdeck.com/pycon2016 and https://github.com/PyCon/2016-slides
item.dc:creator: Christophe Pettus

item.title: PostgreSQL Proficiency for Python People
item.description:
Description

Speaker: Christophe Pettus

PostgreSQL has become the default database for most green-field development projects, and is the data storage architecture behind many major Python-based success stories, such as Instagram. Despite a reputation as being complex and fiddly, Postgres is easy to install, administer, maintain, and use... with just a little bit of orientation. This is that orientation.

Slides can be found at: https://speakerdeck.com/pycon2016 and https://github.com/PyCon/2016-slides
item.dc:creator: Christophe Pettus

item.title: PostgreSQL when it's not your job
item.description:
Summary

In this DevOps world, Django developers are increasingly being asked to manage the database as well. In 40 brisk minutes, we will talk about (nearly) everything you need to know to bring up, tune, and keep a PostgreSQL database health. We'll go over installation, basic tuning, backups, disaster recovery, and helpful tools and techniques.

Description

It's a very rare startup these days that has a full-time DBA on staff; mostly, the developers are pressed into service to handle the database as well. In this talk, we'll present the survival skills required to manage your PostgreSQL database while trying to push the product out the door.

We'll cover:

  • Installation.
  • Basic tuning (it's easier than you think).
  • Performance, including things you must not do.
  • Backups and disaster recovery.
  • Helpful tools, tips and tricks.

Django experience is helpful, but no PostgreSQL experience required.
item.dc:creator: Christophe Pettus

item.title: PostgreSQL in Django 1.8
item.description:
Summary

PostgreSQL in Django 1.8

Among the topics are:

A survey of the new Django 1.8 PostgreSQL features. Using migrations with PostgreSQL in interesting ways. Real-life applications of the new field types. Basic model design for good performance on PostgreSQL.
item.dc:creator: Christophe Pettus

item.title: Django MiniConf: Django Transactions: Past, Present, and Future by Christophe Pettus
item.dc:creator: Christophe Pettus

Django 1.8 adds a whole bunch of cool new features that are specifically designed for PostgreSQL. We'll take a quick tour through them, and show when and how you can use them in real-world applications. We'll also talk about how to get the best performance out of PostgreSQL when using the Django ORM.
